page.title: 07Population - Social Classes
page.content: Class distinction has now almost disappeared. People being judged more for abilities than heritage. The general populous are now independent of landowners, many owning plots of land on which modern bungelows & houses have been erected. Many old tied farm cottages have been sold & occupied by private individuals. There are many self-employed & professional people, craftsmen & people of mixed talents. The falling rolls in the village school reflects a drop in the birthrate. There are fewer young married couples as employment is away from the village. There is a growing number of elderly people, several retired people coming to live in the area. Marriage & traditional values are still widely held.
